verses.text: To the chief Musician upon Neginah, \add A Psalm\add* of David. Hear my cry, O God; attend to my prayer.
From the end of the earth will I cry to thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock \add that\add* is higher than I.
For thou hast been a shelter for me, \add and\add* a strong tower from the enemy.
I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given \add me\add* the heritage of those that fear thy name.
Thou wilt prolong the king's life: \add and\add* his years as many generations.
He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, \add which\add* may preserve him.
So will I sing praise to thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.
